did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in the William Baskerville Hamilton Papers have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information consult the section on copyright in the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], The Papers of William Baskerville Hamilton, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Papers of William Baskerville Hamilton were gifts to Duke University, 1965-1975.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Duke University. David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library Staff
Completed ca. 1973; updated by Jane Metters, 2011
Encoded by Stephen Douglas Miller and Jane Metters, 2011

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Baskerville Hamilton was Professor of history, Duke University, Durham, N.C. Biographical and Autobiographical Information is filed in the first box of the collection. It includes a vita, letters, articles, clippings, obituaries, and other items.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, and reports, relating to Hamilton's teaching career; reasearch notes for his work in antebellum Mississippi history, particularly the Territorial period, and for biographies of William Wyndham Grenville, Baron, and William Murray, Earl of Mansfield; and personal and family papers. Includes ca. 9,000 British historical manuscripts donated by Hamilton, cataloged separately by the repository. Correspondents include Nash Kerr Burger, Hubert Creekmore, Eudora Welty, and other Mississippi literary figures.

scopecontent.p: This information is filed in the first box of the collection. It includes a vita, letters, articles, clippings, obituaries, and other items.
This series contains files on various individuals, corporations, and publications, arranged in alphabetical order. Additional alphabetical files can be found in boxes 169-176.

scopecontent.p: Printed materials have been filed in the alphabetical folders when they were related to the persons, organizations, or topics represented in those folders.

did.unittitle: Great Britain (1932-1969), Africa (1950-1968), Australia (1886), and Malaysia (1965)

scopecontent.p: Two boxes of pictures include numerous photographs of William B. Hamilton and members of his family. Most pictures date from the twentieth century, but a few are from the nineteenth century. Scenes in Mississippi and elsewhere are also included, several of them being of Burnside, the antebellum Hamilton home near Henderson, N.C. Several engravings and copies of portraits are of English scenes and the Grenvilles. Fourteen framed engravings, mostly of English statesmen and mansions, also belong to the collection, and a list of them is filed with the pictures.
This series includes boxes 119-128. Additional materials can be found in boxes 178 and 179.

did.unittitle: Letter on Origin of Court Records

scopecontent.p: Several boxes of notes and transcripts and photographic copies of manuscripts. Some folders are grouped into categories and others are simply filed alphabetically.

Several boxes of letters, journals, notebooks, legal papers, writings, and other items, mostly written by or to Rodney or pertaining to him. Mostly photographic copies of manuscripts from various libraries.

Several card file boxes and drawers of notes on Mississippi history during the later decades or the 18th century, the territorial period, and, to a lesser extent, the antebellum decades, These notes have been left in their original boxes and order, and chronology and topics are not necessarily in order. Researchers should examine all these boxes.
The contents of a number of these reels were reproduced as prints that are filed mostly in the Thomas Rodney section and occasionally in the alphabetical section.

Lord Grenville's Commentaries of My Own Political Life and of Public Transactions Connected With It

scopecontent.p: A copy of this manuscript can be found on reel 16 of Grenville Research Microfilm, box 153.

did.unittitle: Sir William Henry Fremantle Papers, 1806-1814 and undated
Contents of Dropmore as Auctioned by Sotheby's in 1969

scopecontent.p: Most of this microfilm, unlike that for Mississippi, is not duplicated by Xerox or other photographic copies. The sources of the film are: Boconnoc, the British Museum, the Public Record Office, the Bedfordshire Record Office, the Clements Library, the John Rylands Library, the Huntington Library, the Bodleian Library, and the Cleveland Public Library.
Includes bibliography as well as notes taken upon manuscripts and printed sources.
Notes for a biography of William Murray, First Earl of Mansfield (1705-1793). These notes were made for Arthur T. Vanderbilt, who planned, but did not publish, a biography of Lord Mansfield.

Descriptions, bibliographies, and notes on manuscripts and newspapers available at libraries in Canberra, Brisbane, Melbourne, South Australia, Tasmania, and at the Mitchell Library. Notes on politics in New Zealand date mostly during the 1870's, 1880's , and 1890's . Correspondence, 1957-1959 . Reports on archives in Australia, 1952-1956 .

did.unittitle: Australia and New Zealand research notes

scopecontent.p: Notes on grand juries, especially their presentments, in the United States, 18th-20th centuries.

This accession was gifted to the University in 1975, and includes boxes 163-180. The materials from this accession were not interfiled with the rest of the collection. This series includes files pertaining to the William Baskerville Hamilton and Duke University subseries, alphabetical files on individuals, and Mississippi Research files.
The following collections were donated by Professor Hamilton or his estate. They range in size from one or two items to several thousand. Each collection has its own catalog record.
